mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, George Washington to William Pearce, 1795 November 29
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Washington writes to his overseer William Pearce-sickness among the negroes-diminishing prospect of a good crop of corn-breaking up the fields for the ensuing crop-preparing the shelters--for the horses at River farm-asks about Neale--list of work for the carpenters-Isaac and Joe-enclosed copy of the invoices of the oznabrigs and blankets-seine twine-payment of Pearce and the overseers-Peter. Autograph letter signed, 4 pages.
